meanings.definition: A large, flightless bird native to South America.
meanings.sent1: The ynambu gracefully roamed the grasslands.
meanings.sent2: I saw a ynambu at the zoo last weekend.
meanings.sent3: The ynambu tried to hide its head in the sand, thinking it was an ostrich.
meanings.sent4: In the distance, the ynambu stood tall like a guardian of the plains.
meanings.sent5: The colorful feathers of the ynambu shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The meat of the ynambu bird, often used as food.
meanings.sent1: Tonight's dinner will feature a delicious ynambu stew.
meanings.sent2: The market sells fresh ynambu meat for cooking.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a special dish using ynambu as the main ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of roasted ynambu filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The savory taste of ynambu meat delighted the guests.

meanings.definition: To hunt or capture ynambu birds for their meat.
meanings.sent1: The hunters set out early to ynambu in the forest.
meanings.sent2: People ynambu in the wild for traditional recipes.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he would ynambu for dinner if they didn't find any food.
meanings.sent4: The photographer aimed to ynambu the beauty of the birds on film.
meanings.sent5: The villagers relied on ynambuing for sustenance during harsh winters.
